How to wait for a group of process using KAAPI Network interface

Compilation

Simply enter in your build directory examples: 

      > make group

Running

Simply enter 

      > ./group 6 totojdqmjdlq hjdfql todo

that will produces 


Sources


00001 // ==========================================================================
00002 // (c) INRIA, projet MOAIS, 2006
00003 // see the copyright file for more information
00004 // Author: T. Gautier
00005 // - This example shows how to use Net::Group in order to wait of at least
00006 // N process that reaches the group
00007 // ==========================================================================
00008 #include "kaapi_utils"
00009 #include "kaapi_network"
00010 #include <iostream>
00011 
00012 /* MyGroup inherits from Net::Group in order to capture all the events.
00013    When a processus joins a group it send a message to the master processus
00014    (see parameter gid_master in Net::Group::setup method). This message is
00015    broadcast to all known process of the group under a specific message
00016    called 'event'. This is the same process when the processus leave the
00017    group.
00018    MyGroup redefines Net::Group::notify in order to capture such events
00019    and uses synchronization object inherited from Util::Object class from which
00020    derived Net::Group.
00021 */
00022 class MyGroup: public Net::Group, public Util::Object {
00023 public:
00024   MyGroup ()
00025   {}
00026   
00027   // init
00028   void initialize()
00029   {
00030      Net::Group::initialize();
00031      Util::Object::initialize();
00032   }
00033 
00034   // term
00035   void terminate()
00036   {
00037      Net::Group::terminate();
00038      Util::Object::terminate();
00039   }
00040 
00041   // wait until at least n nodes are join the group
00042   void wait( size_t n )
00043   {
00044     Util::CriticalGuard critical(*this);
00045 
00046     // While the size of the group is less than n
00047     while (size() < n)
00048       // Wait... using the method from the class hierarchy: Net::Group::Util::Object::Condition::wait
00049       Util::Object::wait( *this );
00050   }
00051 
00052   // New event defined for this group
00053   enum Event {
00054     E_NEW = 2
00055   };
00056   
00057 protected:
00058   // Inherited from group to capture join/leave/user events
00059   void notify( int e, Net::GlobalId gid, Util::ka_uint64_t value)
00060   {
00061     // Human readable text
00062     static const char* TAB_ACTION[] = {
00063      "join",
00064      "leave"
00065     };
00066     std::cout << Util::Init::local_gid << "::[NOTIFY EVENT] from gid= " << gid 
00067               << ", event= '" << (e < 2 ? TAB_ACTION[e] : " new event")
00068               << "'"
00069               << std::endl;
00070     
00071     // Condition::signal should occurs only if condition size() >= n
00072     if (e == Net::Group::E_JOIN) 
00073     {
00074       Util::Object::broadcast();
00075     }
00076   }
00077 };
00078 
00079 
00080 /* Main of the program:
00081 */
00082 int main (int argc, char* argv[])
00083 {
00084   try {
00085 
00086     /* initialize Network library and return the default network */
00087     Net::Init::component.is_required_by();
00088     Util::KaapiComponentManager::initialize( argc, argv );
00089 
00090     Net::Network* net = Net::Init::network;
00091     
00092     Net::GlobalId gid = Util::Init::local_gid;
00093 
00094     // Create and initialize a group
00095     MyGroup mygroup;
00096     mygroup.initialize();
00097     
00098     // Set parameter of the group: the name 'toto', the master node which is '0'
00099     mygroup.setup( net, "toto", Net::GlobalId::fromint(0) );
00100     
00101     // join the group: toto will receive E_JOIN event
00102     mygroup.join();
00103 
00104     // wait the 3 first added nodes
00105     mygroup.wait( 3 );
00106     
00107     // display informations about nodes in the group
00108     { Util::CriticalGuard critical(mygroup);
00109       int sz = mygroup.size();
00110       std::cout << gid << ":: Size of group:" << sz << " -> ";
00111       for (int i=0; i<sz; ++i)
00112         std::cout << mygroup.get(i) << " ";
00113       std::cout << std::endl << std::flush;
00114     }
00115     
00116     // wait 5 s
00117     Util::Thread::sleep( 5000 );
00118 
00119     // Each process in the group broadcast event with value E_NEW + gid
00120     std::cout << Util::Init::local_gid << "::[main] broadcast value to group" << std::endl;
00121     mygroup.Net::Group::broadcast( MyGroup::E_NEW+ Net::GlobalId::toint(gid) );
00122 
00123     // wait 10 s
00124     Util::Thread::sleep( 10000 );
00125 
00126     /* leave the group  */
00127     std::cout << Util::Init::local_gid << "::[main] leave group" << std::endl;
00128     mygroup.leave();
00129 
00130     std::cout << Util::Init::local_gid << "::[main] Network terminate" << std::endl;
00131     net->terminate();
00132 
00133     std::cout << Util::Init::local_gid << "::[main] KAAPI terminate" << std::endl;
00134     Util::KaapiComponentManager::terminate( );
00135 
00136   } catch (Util::RuntimeError& ex) {
00137     std::cerr << "Catch exception: " << ex.what() << std::endl;
00138   }
00139   catch (...) {
00140     std::cerr << "Unknown exception" << std::endl;
00141   }
00142   return 0;
00143 }
